headline.main: Croix Journal; France, Seams Under Pressure, Remeasures Itself

docs.abstract: France's apparel industry organizes 'National Sizing Campaign' to size up, literally, men, women and children of country; goal is to make clothing that fits better; French have gotten taller and fatter since last they they were measured by apparel industry 30 years ago; information will be used also by makers of other consumer products as well; photo; map (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: Shoulders thrust back, feet spread apart, arms held several inches from her body, Catherine Pottiez stood statue-still in a matching push-up bra and thong as the room turned dark and the scanner did its work. Ten seconds later, her visual image -- and 85 of her measurements -- were projected in 3-D on a computer screen a few feet away.
